raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description:
Settings to be applied to the `authorizationUri` GET request.
Define any query parameters or headers that are required by your OAuth 2.0
authorization server implementation.
This settings can be applied only to `token` and `code` requests
raml-shapes:range.schema-org:name: Authorization settings
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: authorizationSettings

raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description:
Query parameters to be applied to the `authorizationUri`.
Use the same notation as RAML's `queryParameters`.
If you define a parameter that is already defined in OAuth 2.0 specification
(RFC6749) it should be ignored by the processor.
raml-shapes:range.schema-org:name: Authorization query parameters
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: queryParameters

raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description:
Headers to be set on the authorization request.
Use the same notation as RAML's `headers`.
raml-shapes:range.schema-org:name: Authorization headers
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: headers

raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description:
Settings to be applied to the token endpoint POST request.
Define query parameters, headers or custom body paramaeters that should
be included into the request.
Note, as per RFC6749, the request content type is `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`
and the processor has to always assume this content type.
raml-shapes:range.schema-org:name: Access token settings
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: accessTokenSettings

raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description:
Query parameters to be applied to the `accessTokenUri`.
Use the same notation as RAML's `queryParameters`.
OAuth 2.0 specification does not specify any query parameters for this
type of request.
raml-shapes:range.schema-org:name: Token query parameters
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: queryParameters

raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description:
Headers to be set on the token request.
Use the same notation as RAML's `headers`.
raml-shapes:range.schema-org:name: Token request headers
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: headers

raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description:
Body parameters to be applied to the `accessTokenUri`.
Properties will be applied to the default set of OAuth 2.0 token request
parameters.
If you define a parameter that is already defined in OAuth 2.0 specification
(RFC6749) it should be ignored by the processor.
raml-shapes:range.schema-org:name: Token body parameters
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: body

raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description: List of custom authorization granst supported by your OAuth 2.0 server
raml-shapes:range.schema-org:name: Custom authorization grants
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: authorizationGrants

raml-http:schema.schema-org:description: Your api user ID. Some imaginary value.
raml-http:schema.shacl:name: schema

raml-http:parameter.schema-org:description: Your api user ID. Some imaginary value.
raml-http:parameter.schema-org:name: apiUserId

doc:declares.security:name: custom2
doc:declares.schema-org:description: Other custom security method for authorization.

raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description: Always true. Indicates that the response is errord.
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: error

raml-shapes:range.schema-org:description: Human readable message describing the error.
raml-shapes:range.shacl:name: message

raml-http:schema.schema-org:description: Used to send a custom token.
raml-http:schema.shacl:name: schema

raml-http:header.schema-org:description: Used to send a custom token.
raml-http:header.schema-org:name: SpecialToken

raml-http:schema.schema-org:description: Select one of available values to run the request in the debug mode with selected level.
raml-http:schema.shacl:name: schema

raml-http:parameter.schema-org:description: Select one of available values to run the request in the debug mode with selected level.
raml-http:parameter.schema-org:name: debugToken

doc:declares.security:name: custom1
doc:declares.schema-org:description:
A custom security scheme for authenticating requests.
It allows to set `SpecialToken` header from the authorization panel.
The same header should be rendered in the headers editor with console using
RAML JS parser.
With `AMF` console this is separated information.
This scheme also sets `debugToken` and `booleanToken` query parameters.
Both are enums, however `booleanToken` can only have `true` and `false`
values.

doc:declares.security:name: oauth1
doc:declares.schema-org:description: OAuth 1.0 continues to be supported for all API requests, but OAuth 2.0 is now preferred.

data:value.@value: A resource ID that defines a domain of authorization.

A resource ID that defines a domain of authorization.
